title: Hallvard Jonson Smør
text:
Hallvard Jonson Smør (<a href="Floruit">fl.</a> 1368–1372) was a <a href="Norwegian%20people">Norwegian</a> <a href="knight">knight</a>.
Hallvard was a son of <a href="Jon%20Sm%C3%B8r">Jon Smør</a>. In 1368 Hallvard owned <a href="R%C3%B8yken">Røken</a> and <a href="Hurum">Hurum</a> in <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a> syssel, which Gaute Eriksen of the <a href="Galte">Galte</a>-family had owned the year before. He later gave land in "Refvolom" in <a href="Romerike">Romerike</a> for a <a href="Requiem%20Mass">Requiem Mass</a>, which was confirmed by King <a href="Haakon%20VI%20of%20Norway">Haakon VI of Norway</a> in 1372. He was married to an otherwise unknown sister of Svale Ølversson, an "Ølversdotter", and had two known sons, <a href="Jon%20Hallvardson%20Sm%C3%B8r">Jon</a> and <a href="Hallkjell%20Hallvardson%20Sm%C3%B8r">Hallkjell</a>.
